tweets.html:
I don't know how to explain how funny I think it is that NBC, which is already kind of beleaguered, serves continental breakfast. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2012

It's like, "We know you're going to say mean things about us anyway, so here's a cold bagel, jerks." I kind of love it. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2012

#NBC, you did not have any bacon for breakfast. You are already off to a rough #TCA start.

— Jenna Mullins (@JBomb11) July 24, 2012

Pre-NBC session, #tcas12 ballroom is an ocean of open glowing laptops. Looks like the least-winningest video-poker parlor in the world

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 24, 2012

Playing "Suddenly I See" at the beginning of NBC's #TCAs2012 session feels sort of like the network wishing for clarity and purpose.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) July 24, 2012

NBC's press tour this year feels like that year you went to the local Holiday Inn for vacation because your dad lost his job. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

Since I'm not at TCA, I'm going to help out everyone on my feed by retweeting every TCA tweet that appears.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) July 24, 2012

Greenblatt, the man heralded for bringing sophistication to NBC from Showtime, just mentioned That One Show With the Monkey In It. #tcas12

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 24, 2012

#NBC prez thanks reporters for their patience and positivity over the last year. It's official: he does not follow me on Twitter. #TCAs12

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) July 24, 2012

NBC: "We're proud to be number 3...and we have a monkey!" #tcas12

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 24, 2012

What's different about The Voice: Fall edition? The four judges are pumpkins. #tcas12 #nbc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

"I would categorically not rule out that it's not the last season." Greenblatt on Community and why double negatives are confusing. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

Click CLICK CLICK. When Greenblatt says the word "Community" immediately the sound of typing in the ballroom ramps up. #TCAS12

— Melissa Grego (@melissagrego) July 24, 2012

TV critic disapproval measured in flurry of little keystrokes every time NBC executive says something they disagree with or doubt. #tcas12

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) July 24, 2012

A spin-off of The Office could run on the awkwardness of the NBC #TCAs12 panel. The live-tweeting is always schadenfreude in slow motion.

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) July 24, 2012

Transition, broaden, broaden, transition, broaden, transition. #shortergreenblatt #TCAs12

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) July 24, 2012

the password for today's #NBC session: "broaden" #tcas12

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) July 24, 2012

When NBC says "broadening," what they mean is, "We're going to make shitty shows, because we think that's what America wants." #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

America might watch bad TV. It might watch a lot of bad TV. But it has never--and will never--watch INTENTIONALLY bad TV. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

Basically, NBC is saying America is too stupid for their Thursday night comedies, right? #TCA12

— tierney bricker (@tbrick2) July 24, 2012

Critic tries to ask NBC nicely "Does broadening your comedy equal making it cuter and dumber?" #TCAs12

— Eric Deggans at NPR (@Deggans) July 24, 2012

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
What Greenblatt is saying about comedy audience is depressing, but so are the ratings of NBC comedies vs. CBS comedies. #TCA12

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) July 24, 2012

Dear NBC: you already have a great comedy that's "soulful" and very funny - it's called #ParksAndRecreation. Please promote it more! thanks

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) July 24, 2012

Room turning on #NBC execs as move away from smart comedies to broad, dumb ones sinks in #tcas12

— Bill Brioux (@BillBriouxTV) July 24, 2012

I'm not saying NBC doesn't need to broaden. But if it wants to do shitty TV, then do shitty TV with integrity. That's what CBS gets. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

I'm fascinated by the tweets from TCA, which sound like they're coming from inside Showtime's Episodes.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) July 24, 2012

Greenblatt re developing NBC's new comedies:"You go step by step." in related news, NBC will bring back Step By Step. #TGIF #tcas12

— kentucker (@kentucker) July 24, 2012

What I'm saying is that #NBC needs MY pitch for their NEXT GREAT COMEDY: The Cat Who Was A Lawyer. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

Going off Twitter for a while. Let me know if the monkey from #AnimalPractice unleashes the virus from "Outbreak" at the #TCAs2012.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 24, 2012

Among the participants on NBC's remaining panels today: General Wesley Clark, NeNe Leakes, Picabo Street, Matthew Perry, a monkey. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2012

NBC's Bob Greenblatt just read back to us some of the more scathing tweets about his session. It was oddly mortifying! #TCAs12

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) July 24, 2012

Bob Greenblatt is aware of my Twitter presence. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

And said that Todd should be the new showrunner of #Community. RT @tvoti: Bob Greenblatt is aware of my Twitter presence. #tcas12

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) July 24, 2012

Now NBC is taunting us to tweet meanly about them. NO! I'm NOT YOUR MONKEY! [Crystal is.] #tcast12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2012

RT @VladaGelman: NBC chairman Bob Greenblatt is reading back snarky tweets to us // Tell him about @GoodTVeets. NBC gets killed there often!

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) July 24, 2012

Greenblatt reading snarky tweets is kind of the worst thing I've ever heard. I say: bitch move. #armchairTCA (Yeah, that's gonna be the tag)

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) July 24, 2012

The hijiks this morning at the NBC TCA further support my assertion that TCA is broken #TCAs12

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) July 24, 2012

The desperation of critics to craft a tweet worthy of being read by Bob Greenblatt seems to match NBC's desperation. #TCAs12

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) July 24, 2012

NBC day at #TCAs12 is developing sentience and self-awareness. No one give Greenblatt the nuclear codes.

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) July 24, 2012

Up next, NBC's Firefighting Hunk of the Month Calendar drama "Chicago Fire." #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2012

Twist: The only person taking off his shirt during the "Chicago Fire" panel will be Dick Wolf.

— Rick Porter (@rickporter) July 24, 2012

I always like panels with Dick Wolf, because I like to be lectured about how much money his shows make & how we should report that.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 24, 2012

Dick Wolf scanning the ballroom, trying to figure out where the most surprising place to find a body would be. #TCAs12 #dundun

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) July 24, 2012

#ChicagoFire is the "for this I went to Juilliard" series of the year. Several grads in the cast. #tcas12 #nbc

— Bruce R. Miller (@siouxbruce) July 24, 2012

If a MOB DOCTOR treated someone burned in a CHICAGO FIRE, would anyone actually watch?

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 24, 2012

I can't yet judge CHICAGO FIRE, but good or bad it looks like the most exciting new show of 1994. #tcas12

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 24, 2012

There are 438 shows on TV about Chicago right now, and yet none of them are about @moryan. This is ridiculous.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 24, 2012

Up next at #TCAs12: "Animal Practice." Starting to fear they won't give us Crystal the monkey just to mess with us.

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) July 24, 2012

The mood for the imminent #AnimalPractice panel -- if the monkey is not here, I think the room's going to turn ugly. #tcas12

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) July 24, 2012

The monkey is not on the #AnimalPractice panel. I'm out. #TCAs12

— Danielle Turchiano (@danielletbd) July 24, 2012

There is apparently a new ANIMAL PRACTICE pilot, with casting changes and yet with NO ADDITIONAL MONKEY. #tcas12

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 24, 2012

I like Animal Practice more than most critics. By which I mean I don't want to bury it beneath the Earth from whence it came. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

WE HAVE NO MONKEY ON THIS PANEL. THERE WAS A MONKEY ON THE LIST. THIS WILL NOT STAND. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2012

We are now asking the cast about their pets. I'm really beginning to wonder whether I have hit my head. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2012

Crystal the Monkey not attending the #TOSWMII panel. Hope she will be available for one-on-ones at the NBC cocktail party. #tcas12

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 24, 2012

Q: Did you draw on your personal experience in any way to develop your character? A: EEEEEEEEEEEEEEE #tcas12 #TOSWMII #monkey

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 24, 2012

Three years from now, I GUARANTEE Crystal the Monkey will be skipping "Animal Practice" table reads and suing the studio. #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2012

In January when Animal Practice bcomes the hit of the fall season I hope Bob Greneblatt stand up there+throws monkey feces at u all#TCAs12

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) July 24, 2012

"Why don't we have the dog start tap dancing?" Producer suggests joke rejected for being too broad. An NBC exec just got a new idea. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

THE MONKEY IS HERE! #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

I hope my tweet reading "THE MONKEY IS HERE! #tcas12" is the only thing that survives the demise of Western civilization.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

The monkey has just entered riding an ambulance, and we all laughed, so we are all huge jerks and WE ARE PWNED BY THIS MONKEY. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2012

The many tweets screaming “THE MONKEY HAS LANDED” make me worry that TCA has become a mass hallucination.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) July 24, 2012

Well that panel confirmed bot a)Animal Practice deserved the #MASKY and b)TCA is broke. #TCAs12

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) July 24, 2012

I should't ask Ryan Murphy if #TheNewNormal is an argument against its main gay couple having kids, right? Because they are the worst.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) July 24, 2012

NBC says JJ Abrams can't be here for "Revolution" panel. I'm thinking he'll surprisingly ride out on the monkey's ambulance. #TCAs12

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) July 24, 2012

Producers of REVOLUTION say their reason why power went out wd actually work. So to stay on air they could threaten to destroy civilization.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 24, 2012

My theory on why electricity stops working in #Revolution: Not enough breakdance-based boogaloo, clearly. #dropsthemic

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 24, 2012

NBC primetime: 3-5 years behind every trend. RT @nprmonkeysee: NBC ordering 10 episodes of a Dracula show starring Jonathan Rhys Meyers.

— 🎄Chris Wilson🎄 (@realchriswilson) July 24, 2012

Bob Greenblatt says maybe we'll tweet about #Dracula. What, so you can have more material to mock us with? #tcas12

— Marisa Roffman (@marisaroffman) July 24, 2012

Oh hey NBC is making Draculazzzzzzzzzzzzzzz.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 24, 2012

In "Ready for Love," people date in a way they've NEVER dated before... through a TV show. #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2012

At #TCAs12, it is time for more "really, NBC, really?" NBC reality shows: dating series Ready for Love and Mark Burnett's Stars Earn Stripes

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) July 24, 2012

Matchmakers help three shirtless men get love among 27 women who stalked them on Facebook. #ReadyForLove #nbc #tcas12

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) July 24, 2012

"We REALLY came here because we REALLY want to find someone to spend the rest of our lives with." -- Dude on this show, and all Bachelors.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2012

BREAKING: Men of "Ready for Love" actually want to find love, unlike the people on every other dating show who say the same thing.

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) July 24, 2012

I will watch "Ready for Love" to root against these bachelors finding love on "Ready for Love."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2012

I no longer believe in love. #readyforlove #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2012

The cast and producers of NBC's Ready for Love really, really believe this dating reality show will change America. They're so cute. #TCAs12

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) July 24, 2012

Matchmaker Tracy McMillan says #ReadyForLove is a national conversation about love. #nbc #tcas12

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) July 24, 2012

Ken Burns' "Dust Bowl" panel wasn't this devoted to its own ability to change the way we think. #tcas12 #readyforlove

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2012

"Look forward to Ready For Love," says the NBC guy, with a note of ominousness. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 25, 2012

A very cute little kid just sat next to me in the Beverly Hilton lobby. Should I tell him Whitney Houston died here?

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) July 24, 2012

There is very little that NBC has done today that isn't just baffling. #tcas12

— Marisa Roffman (@marisaroffman) July 25, 2012

Up next: STAY OUT OF IT, NICK LACHEY. THE PANEL. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 25, 2012

Next panel: STARS EARN STRIPES, where B/C-list celebs go to boot camp. Which at this point could fully staff our entire military. #tcas12

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 25, 2012

Dick Wolf is wearing something from his "Law & Order: Gap Outlet Unit" collection. #tcas12

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) July 25, 2012

NBC doesn't need "broader shows," it needs help. Specifically the help of taking it behind the shed and putting it down with both barrels.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) July 25, 2012

Hope someone asks the panel of #StarsEarnStripes if any of them are Ready For Love.

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 25, 2012

I look forward to the HBO movie about prepping Todd Palin to promote Stars Earn Stripes at #TCAs12. (He has the same answer for everything.)

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) July 25, 2012

I would also like to point out that for the amount we bitch about #Bunheads, neither of us can stop watching. It's the new #Smash. -H

— Heather & Jessica (@fuggirls) July 25, 2012

OMG. THE #BUNHEADS DANCE ENDING. You warned me, but still. I should not be too stupid to understand this show, yet suddenly I might be -H

— Heather & Jessica (@fuggirls) July 25, 2012

Nobody ever said on their deathbed they wished they spent more time on Twitter. They tweeted it and came up with a funny hashtag.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) July 24, 2012

Honest to God thought that #MobDoctor was a CBS show based off the title alone. #FOX

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 24, 2012

Manny is their lawyer . RT @THR
'Modern Family' Cast Sues 20th TV as Contract Renegotiation Turns Ugly

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) July 24, 2012

If Jesse Tyler Ferguson and Eric Stonestreet hold out too long, ABC should just trade 'em to "The New Normal."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2012

Theyre finally acting like MY family RT @LaceyVRose: #ModernFamily Cast Sues 20thTV, Contract Renegotiation Turns UGLY http://t.co/ReaCCotM

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) July 24, 2012

A maximum of three car-accident-related plots per season. #ModernFamilyCastDemands

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 24, 2012

Modern Family suing over contract negotiations? Look Emmys! It's a regular show, like the others! I've heard everyone involved poops too!

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) July 24, 2012

Are they really still filming new footage for Modern Family? I could have sworn last season was just spliced together from old episodes.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) July 24, 2012

First episode of ModFam season four. All is quiet, but for the wind. Ariel Winter polishes a battleaxe. "It's been quiet. Since THEY came."

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2012

Revised MODERN FAMILY opener: While most of the family flies to Hawaii, they accidentally leave behind Manny and Luke, who are HOME ALONE!

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) July 24, 2012

Breaking: Orlando trades Dwight Howard to "Modern Family" for Sofia Vergara and A Lily To Be Cast Later.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2012

Am I the only person that would rather see #ModernFamily without Gloria, Cam, Mitchell, Claire, and Phil?

— robert kessler (@thebobkessler) July 24, 2012

Looking forward to the season opener of Modern Family that introduces Lily's new dads, Coy and Vance.

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) July 24, 2012

If #ModernFamily contract negotiations are anything like the show, the cast just got into car accidents on the way to the table read.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 24, 2012

The saddest part of the new Martin Scorsese ad for iPhone is when Siri can't answer the query, "Siri, where is my dignity?"

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) July 24, 2012

Scorsese's Siri ad: http://t.co/3kzJZPAH
I like to think it's the same character as the one he played in Taxi Driver: http://t.co/O7R4mtqB

— Andrew Ellard (@ellardent) July 24, 2012

I assume Siri is unable to answer the 800 questions Martin Scorsese asks in the 30-second entirety of that new iPhone ad.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 24, 2012

“Siri, is that DiCaprio?” “I think you meant to type DeNiro, Marty.”

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) July 25, 2012

Feeling like Peggy Olsen in my professional life, Lane Pryce in my writing life and Pete Campbell in my personal life. #MadMen

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) July 24, 2012

Surely I'm not the only one who yells "holla" whenever Final Jeopardy is TV related.

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) July 25, 2012

Re: my earlier #MadMen tweet, ideal is to be Don Draper in professional life, Roger Sterling in writing life, Bert Cooper in personal life.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) July 25, 2012

Okay, revised #MadMen ideals: Don Draper in professional life, Ken Cosgrove in writing life, Roger Sterling in personal life.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) July 25, 2012

Have I told you lately that Pawnee rocks? Seriously.

— Perd Hapley (@PerdHapley) July 25, 2012

If I was dating a dude and he told me he was CIA I would be all "sweeeeeeeet" not "you lied to me, jerk!" #thesechicks #CovertAffairs

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 25, 2012

Sometimes, when I'm watching #CovertAffairs, I chant "Auggie Auggie Auggie, oi oi oi!" and then laugh and laugh. I don't have many friends.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 25, 2012

Christ... just one reality competition show, just one, have a host say in the pre-show piece, "This line up? This line up is just okay."

— kevinbiegel (@kbiegel) July 25, 2012

Dan is shirtless and wearing a fedora. It's like he knows I'm watching. #BB14 #BBAfterDark

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 25, 2012

Andy Cohen has imprisoned Amy Sedaris in is clubhouse. When will we stand up and fight?

— Erin Hill (@ErinHill2) July 25, 2012

Dad: LA Complex scares me about LA. Me: It's really not that bad. Dad: But like how dark is it? #LAComplexTexts

— Chela (@ChelseyLora) July 25, 2012

Nothing like digging into tech websites to troubleshoot a malfunctioning television to remind me how little I actually know about TV sets.

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) July 25, 2012

@jmittell just hit it on the side. It’s worked for almost seventy years.

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 25, 2012

This could be about anybody! RT @Lesismore9o9: I hate this guy. #Smash

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) July 25, 2012

for the record , I never wanted to burn the money ..I followed the script ..almost got beat up by 10 mexicans at a laker game cause of it

— Kenny Johnson (@TheKennyJohnson) July 25, 2012
